turns.content:
Briefly discuss the notion of personality together with its attributes. In doing it you are required to show 

➪  How personality commences and ends.
➪  As well as compare and contrast the two types of person’s viz., physical person and artificial persons.

(expanded the idea so largely and use at least 20 paragraph's to explain it )

Personality refers to the unique set of characteristics, traits, and patterns of behavior that define an individual. It is the sum total of an individual's emotional, cognitive, and behavioral characteristics that influence their interactions with others and the world around them.

Personality begins to develop in early childhood and continues to evolve throughout a person's life. It is shaped by a combination of genetic and environmental factors, including genetics, family dynamics, culture, and life experiences.

There are many different theories of personality, each of which focuses on different aspects of the personality. The most widely accepted theories include the psychoanalytic theory, the humanistic theory, and the trait theory.

The psychoanalytic theory, developed by Sigmund Freud, suggests that personality is shaped by the unconscious mind and that early childhood experiences play a significant role in shaping one's personality. The humanistic theory, developed by Carl Rogers, emphasizes the innate goodness of people and the importance of self-actualization. The trait theory, which is based on the measurement of personality traits, suggests that personality is made up of a combination of different traits that are relatively stable across time and situations.

There are also many different ways to measure personality, including self-report measures, observer ratings, and objective tests. These methods can help researchers and practitioners understand an individual's personality, and can be used in a variety of settings, such as in therapy, education, and employment.

Physical persons are those individuals who are biological entities, they are human beings. They have a physical body, mind and emotions. They have consciousness, self-awareness and the ability to think, feel and make decisions. They are capable of experiencing different emotions, and are capable of communicating with other physical persons. They are also capable of experiencing physical sensations such as hunger, thirst, pain, pleasure and fatigue.

On the other hand, artificial persons are those individuals who are not biological entities, but are created by humans. They are typically referred to as artificial intelligence or AI. They are software-based entities that can be trained to perform specific tasks, but they lack consciousness, self-awareness and the ability to think, feel and make decisions. They do not have the ability to experience emotions, and are not capable of communicating with other physical persons. They are also not capable of experiencing physical sensations such as hunger, thirst, pain, pleasure, and fatigue.

In conclusion, personality is a complex and multi-faceted construct that is shaped by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. It begins to develop in early childhood and continues to evolve throughout a person's life. There are many different theories of personality, each of which focuses on different aspects of the personality, and many different ways to measure personality. Physical persons and artificial persons are different entities with different characteristics, abilities and limitations. Physical persons are biological entities, have consciousness, self-awareness and the ability to think, feel and make decisions. Artificial persons, on the other hand, are software-based entities that are capable of performing specific tasks but lack consciousness, self-awareness and the ability to think, feel and make decisions.
